title: Tohono Oʼodham
summary: The Tohono O'odham (/θɔːˈnɔː ˈɔːθəm/)[2] are a Native American people of the Sonoran Desert, residing primarily in the U.S. state of Arizona and the northern Mexican state of Sonora. Tohono O'odham means "Desert People." The federally recognized tribe is known in the United States as the Tohono O'odham Nation.
